TopicTitle: A Mod causes dual/double part in Game

Articles.Content:
First of all IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m not sure of this correct section to post this in, Last night I installed a new mod & overwritten the needed support mod no problem there but the odd thing the mod itself somehow made duplicate parts of every single part in the mod. I tried deleting all of the files that came with the new mod & rebooting the game & then reinstalling the mod but the duplicate parts are still there.

I prefer not to name the new mod because IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m pretty sure the error is my fault, but IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m running Window 7 in 32 bit & KSP 1.0.4 in 32 bit. This there a way I can fix it where I can have a single copy of the mod.

Thanks,

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-25T17:26:11Z" title="07/25/2015 05:26  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 25, 2015</time> by Turk\_WLF**

> 
> I prefer not to name the new mod because IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m pretty sure the error is my fault, but IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m running Window 7 in 32 bit & KSP 1.0.4 in 32 bit. This there a way I can fix it where I can have a single copy of the mod.

I think you should probably give us the name of the mod. Also you should follow the How to get support thread and add your Unity player.log. That would probably help quite a bit.

It appears that I have found a work-around answer, it seems that I had a double posting of the part(s) within my PartDatabase.cfg. I'm not sure if deleting it really has remove the files or just blocking the game from access the hidden files. I went a completely deleted the mod in question (Mark IV Spaceplane System), even so after delete the mod I still have a couple of the engines that came with the mod.

I don't have access to a third party site that allows to share files like the KSP.log & I couldn't find my unity player.log.

If you are using Windows, it is called output\_log.txt. It is in the folder KSP\_Data.

Use a site like Dropbox to post a link to your logs.
